meanings.definition: The theory or practice of shielding a country's domestic industries from foreign competition through tariffs or quotas.
meanings.sent1: Some people believe that protectionism helps local businesses thrive.
meanings.sent2: Protectionism can impact the prices of imported goods.
meanings.sent3: The debate on protectionism versus free trade can get quite heated.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of protectionism versus globalization, each side has valid points.
meanings.sent5: The concept of protectionism is like building a fence around your garden to keep out unwanted pests.

meanings.definition: The policy or practice of protecting domestic producers by imposing restrictions on foreign trade.
meanings.sent1: Protectionism aims to shield local farmers from cheap imports.
meanings.sent2: Countries sometimes resort to protectionism during economic downturns.
meanings.sent3: The idea of protectionism can be seen as a form of economic self-defense.
meanings.sent4: The effects of protectionism on global markets can be far-reaching.
meanings.sent5: Implementing protectionism is like putting up barriers to safeguard your own interests.
